svg.style: font-family: 'Helvetica Neue', Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 18px; background-color: white; text-rendering: optimizeLegibility; -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased;

text.tspan: Total tax revenue (%GDP) vs State effectiveness, 2013
Total tax revenue includes social contributions, direct and indirect taxes. State effectiveness is measured through
scores across four dimensions: Security Effectiveness, Political Effectiveness, Economic Effectiveness, and Social
Effectiveness. Scores are obtained via a process involving content analysis, quantitative data, and qualitative review.
Higher scores correspond to lower state effectiveness.
State effectiveness score (0-13, higher values imply lower effectiveness)
Source: ICTD - Government Revenue Dataset, November 2017, Center for Systemic Peace via the Quality of Government dataset
